website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if you are looking for an electric model with a spacious cooktop and oven, but there's the possibility of some mechanical issues.
pros: Convection electric range with ceramic cooktop
Features 5 burners and a spacious oven
Attractive black and stainless steel construction looks great in modern kitchens
cons: Some issues with the self-cleaning feature and temperature control have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your $$$
customer_reviews.text: Samsung doesn't honour there warranty Glass broke after 2 years. After 1 year Touch screen overheated and broke from running the self clean option on the oven. Feel free to Google Samsung appliance warranties. They will just give you the runaround and we'll never fix anything
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: It's a beautiful range and looks great with our kitchen remodel
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful range and looks great with our kitchen remodel. Does a fine job cooking top of stove and both convection and regular oven use. Love the stay warm burner. Still getting used to the front panel for oven use, timer, etc. but so far so good. Only two problems....the timer volume is too low and can't be raised...and the glass surface is tough to keep clean and shiny looking.
customer_reviews.author: bonniefl

customer_reviews.title: Stove is amazing! Thank YOU
customer_reviews.text: Ordered in November from Lowes and still had nit recieved as of February so I checked on line at Amazon and ordered recieved in less than 2 weeks! Now I have my new granite countertops installed and is gorgeous. Kitchen completed. Stove is amazing! Thank YOU. Amazon ☺
customer_reviews.author: sandy templeman

customer_reviews.title: Nice range for a great price
customer_reviews.text: The range is great and very happy with the purchase. Will definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Moha

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Still scared of the touchy surface, but I'm getting there.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt - Medford, Or

customer_reviews.title: I love the option to choose convection oven or standard bake
customer_reviews.text: This range is gorgeous and performs well beyond my expectations! I love the option to choose convection oven or standard bake. The manual that came with it was not extremely helpful, especially on how to correctly operate the probe. Also, I wish that Samsung made it easier to order the back gap kit for replacing a standard range with a slide in. Mine didn't come with it and it's been problematic to order one. BUT... the range itself is amazing. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful experience...
customer_reviews.text: Great price, looks and works perfectly. Delivered on time as promised and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara P.

customer_reviews.title: Great stove. Have used every function and have no ...
customer_reviews.text: Great stove. Have used every function and have no complaints. So much better than the GE which will go to the cabin. I wanted front controls and they are very easy to use. It came well packaged right to our door. So glad we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Parks

customer_reviews.title: I think it's terrific, except for two things
customer_reviews.text: I think it's terrific, except for two things: It's too easy to bump the controls and accidentally turn the stove on. And because it's electric, it's too easy to not notice that the stove is on.
customer_reviews.author: rpp

customer_reviews.title: Love this range
customer_reviews.text: Love this range! I cook professionally this range has all the benefits for a electric range I need at home.. The look and style are great.....
customer_reviews.author: John Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Top notch.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and have not installed yet. Looking forward to years of good cooking.
customer_reviews.author: RioRichard

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size was delivered.
customer_reviews.text: The range is fine... however, when I placed an order, I typed in and ordered a 36 inch electric range... but the 29.9 inch range arrived instead. Since I can not return it, I am stuck with it. now I have a 6 inch gap between my kitchen counters and I need to spend more money on granite and cabinetry fillers. Needless to say, I am not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Diana And Milana Day

customer_reviews.title: Cracks in Glass Cook top are not covered under warranty
customer_reviews.text: Glass top has 5 years warranty which Samsung offer but doesn't honor. My glass cook top developed cracks due to material defects. When contacted their support the refused to repair the range saying damage to glass is not covered. If cracks in glass are not covered then what else is covered for the glass. I purchased Samsung brand thinking that they will stand behind their warranty but they failed to do that.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: COOKTOP CRACKED ON FIRST USE
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 4 new black stainless appliances for our kitchen from BB. My cooktop cracked the first time I used it. I called the store where we purchased it - BB and they basically said that it wasn't their problem and to contact Samsung. Samsung sent someone out to look at it and the kid said that it was cosmetic and they would not replace it. I'm not even sure it's safe to use. Be ware of Samsung products and their warranties-not worth the paper they are written on. Update: after Samsung refused to do anything about the cracked cooktop, I went back to BB. After explaining what Samsung said, they are replacing the entire stove!!! Thank you BB.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE....Do Not Buy.
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE! I have also had some very serious issues with this range, and my experience with my Samsung warranty and Samsung customer service has also been absolutely awful. We also bought our range in 2014 and after only 1 year the oven part of the range just stopped working.The stove top was and still is working. So my warranty does not cover this, and I am left with a non-functioning oven.And now I see that others have found it to be a fire hazard. $1500 dollars down the drain. STAY AWAY FROM THIS RANGE AND SAMSUNG PRODUCTS. They do not stand behind their inferior products.
customer_reviews.author: S.Q.

customer_reviews.title: My big gripe right now is that pans scratch the glass top easily. I called my warranty and was told that ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to agree with those who say the burners turn on at the slightest bump. So DON'T LEAVE ANYTHING ON STOVE! My big gripe right now is that pans scratch the glass top easily. I called my warranty and was told that is a "cosmetic" defect" and not covered. Lovely, having a stove with a swirl of easily seen scratches on it! I've had glass tops for the last twenty years and my old stoves never did this. Beware of this problem
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Samsung, Poor Quality Control and No Responsibility
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this range three years ago thankfully with a private extended warrantee. I love all the cooking features. Whenever I put the oven on self-clean it would lock (which it is supposed to do). Then the heat would ramp up burning out the inside electronics and the front electrical panel. Calling on Samsung during the first year of this continuing problem did no good. I obviously got a lemon. Many lock-outs and replacement parts from my extended warrantee company has them at a loss of money. I have yet to have the oven self-clean and not burn out. I will be using the lemon law to litigate. Samsung has taken no responsibility for it's product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard in more ways than one
customer_reviews.text: I used this range semi-happily for 5 months before one night it started to hum, buzz and electrical smoke came out the back. The problem with this range, and probably and range with a font control board, is that if you chose to use the upper broiler function, the unit gets too hot and there's not any protection from it frying the circuitry in the front control panel and upper burners. Ours melted and nearly caught fire. There's better slide in ranges, folks. This one is a fire hazard in more than one way. Samsung warranty has been impossible.
customer_reviews.author: K. bills

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this stove for 4 months. The knobs turn on if I accidentally touch them with my hip while working in the kitchen. A fire hazard, so I leave NOTHING on top of the stove. If you have children, do not buy this stove. The black ceramic top is a horror to keep clean. And it scratches easily. I use calphalon pans & lift them when moving them, but still get scratches on the stove top. If I try the double convection oven, the top oven overcooks the top of the dish; the bottom oven overcooks the bottom of the dish. The stove was expensive so I can't replace it, but I would not recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: bozze

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality, Possible Fire Hazard
customer_reviews.text: Have owned it 6 months, light use (we cook about once a week on it) Top is already de-laminating. Samsung customer service is a bear to deal with. Call customer service, get run through the ringer, they set up appointments and cancel them with out calling you, you have to advocate just to get someone to look at the thing. Then they tell you it's their policy that it could be caused by improper maintenance and it's just cosmetic so it's not covered. It's only cosmetic until it starts a fire guys!
customer_reviews.author: Ted Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A COMPLETE FIRE HAZARD AND WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: NEVER EVER EVER buy a Samsung product. This electric Range has been possessed since we bought it. First the black stainless started peeling. Then the top CRACKED. Absolute minimal usage. Lowes refuses to honor the 3 year warrantly. THIS IS A COMPLETE FIRE HAZARD AND WASTE OF MONEY. I burned myself, because the knobs turn on just when you pass by. This will be a class action suit... I have a 1300 range with cracked top, electric shocks from the top, and burns throughtout my house and on my body. Samsung sent people, they refuse to cover even thought I purchased the 3 year warranty. DO NOT BUY THIS RANGE OR ANY OTHER SAMSUNG APPLIANCE.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: An absolute nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last December (2014) from Lowes in Athens, GA. On August 22nd the oven went. Lowes set me up for service but Samsung only has a few service providers and in my case that provider is an hour away. They only visit Athens once a week. The oven was serviced on Sept. 1st. In less than an hour it failed again. I was cooking pizza when I heard a loud bang and sparks flew out of the oven. It took another week for service (of course) and the guy still couldn't fix it. I haven't had a working oven in three weeks. I've called Samsung to complain. They don't care. My problem. Don't make it your problem too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carr

customer_reviews.title: This Range looks nice, however
customer_reviews.text: This Range looks nice, however, the knobs loosen over time and turn on too easily. The can turn on even if you slightly come in contact with them as you pass the range unknowingly. This caused a fire on top of my range with a wood cutting board and recently a glass dish shattered with chicken marinated in it that was placed for a brief moment on top of a cold stove that was off, but was turned on by a passer by in the kitchen. Please beware of this issue, so far Samsung has not issued a recall or a solution for this problem. This stove should be recalled.
customer_reviews.author: Lax Mom shopper

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard!
customer_reviews.text: I initially liked everything about this range. However, in the seven months we've had it, the knobs to the stove eyes will turn on with the SLIGHTEST bump. At least once a month someone will bump a knob and unknowingly turn a stove eye on! We've only noticed when we started to smell something burn. I notified Samsung and they were NO help - USELESS! They claim this is the first time they've had a complaint regarding this concern (even though many sellers of this range have customer reviews stating the same complaint)! Decent range but in NO way worth the fire risk - especially if you have children. And, I will avoid Samsung purchases in the future.
customer_reviews.author: TIKI

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY - Glass top not under warranty and is very fragile
customer_reviews.text: A houseguest put a room temperature pot on a hot burner and the top split into pieces with cracks all over. It will cost $500 for parts and service. The stove is great looking but the top is horrible to keep clean, it gets spots and marks that will not come off, and yes, I've tried all the cleaning suggestions. I haven't yet replaced the top because $500 seems like a lot to pay to repair a design defect which will probably happen again. I never heard of electric stovetops shattering before but this seems to be a common problem with this Samsung stove. Samsungs PR seems to be better than its products.
customer_reviews.author: alijo

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from Samsung glasstop ranges
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. We had it 5 months and it cracked while heating a pot on the stove. Called Samsung and, of course, the 1 year warranty, does not cover the cracked glass incurred during the course of everyday cooking. Was not caused by anything other than turning on the stove and heating up a pot of water. Repairman said this happens all the time to Samsung glass tops and they should not even be selling these stoves! Repairing it is useless as it cost half of what I paid with no guarantee that it won't happen again!! Giving 1 star because you have to enter at least 1 star to submit but not worth that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The knobs are loose fitting and extremely dangerous. The ...
customer_reviews.text: The knobs are loose fitting and extremely dangerous. The burners can be turned on accidentally. This morning our cat bumped one and turned it on; yes the cat jumped up onto the counter and turned the burner on in its leap. My husband and I have both accidentally turned on a burner. This is a real hazard, and the company should have fixed the problem. I am not the only one who has complained about this; WHY DON'T THEY FIX IT?
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!!!! The knobs are so ...
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE!!!!! The knobs are so sensitive that if you should brush against them, the burners turn on. No pushing and turning necessary. Many times in the 18 months I have owned this have I inadvertently turned on the burner by reaching to the cupboard next to the stove. Samsung is aware of this, say it is a design flaw, not interested in hearing about it again since nobody in my household has been hurt. I guess it will take a lot of households getting hurt or starting fires before they will recall or come up with a fix. I would absolutely stay away from this stove because of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Chaison-Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Beware of faulty device and terrible company policies
customer_reviews.text: Warranty of the glass cooktop is fake. They seem to determine any crack in the glasstop as "physical damage" caused by user accident or abuse, and use that excuse to not honor the warranty. Ours spontaneously cracked (upon heating up) 2 years into owning the unit, and they refused to cover it - even at the higher levels of customer service. Beware of faulty device and terrible company policies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Samsung cooktop - warranty is lames and so is customer service
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy a Samsung cooktop again. Glass cracked and they won't fix, stove is less than 8 months old.
customer_reviews.author: JWS

customer_reviews.title: cracked top
customer_reviews.text: The glass top cracked at 2 years and Samsung says it's physical damage so they will not honor the 5 year warranty. It's costing me $450 to repair and now I'm not sure it will not crack again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Schuhler

customer_reviews.title: this stove is a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Boil over a pot once and your cooktop is stained forever. Knobs do not lock in on a setting - so if you want to keep the heat on a pot then you have to continue to move the dial. Worst part is that the oven does not keep it temperature. You preheat the oven but then the temperature goes down Occasionaly it works correctly but generally it is a piece of junk. l You cannot bake in this oven. Samsung wants $ 200 just to look at it. Your rating of 2.9 should read 2.0.
customer_reviews.author: chubby Senoia

customer_reviews.title: This was installed in our house when we bought it ...
customer_reviews.text: This was installed in our house when we bought it. The self-cleaning cycle shorted out the motherboard the first time we used it. Now, less than 3 years later, the fan in the oven is making a horrendous noise. Anytime we attempted to broil anything it would incinerate it, so we have given up on that functionality altogether.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Bears Fan

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive knobs caused a house fire.
customer_reviews.text: One of my kids bumped the knob on her way our to the school bus. There was a pizza cutter on the burner that caught on fire. Be very careful if you purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great appliance until...
customer_reviews.text: Loved this stove when we first got it. Then, after 8 months the enamel coating on the floor of the oven started flaking off and it began to rust. I contacted Samsung and was told that this was a "cosmetic issue" and not covered under warranty. Seems to me that when a stove starts rusting away after 8 months the issue is more than cosmetic. More disappointing that Samsung wont stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: NiloX

customer_reviews.title: Great looks and functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing range, looks fantastic and very functional. I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Bought this oven 18 months ago. The touch control ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this oven 18 months ago. The touch control panel died unexpectedly, causing the oven not to work. Samsung's limited warrantee didn't cover the defect. Now I'm out $400 with no guarantee that the panel won't fry again. Give me old fashion manual controls over small computer boards that can be temperamental and subject to constant replacements. Never would buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our new kitchen. So far, so good. We are very happy with the split oven feature and quality and evenness of the probed meat feature. Range top if fantastic, once you get use to the controls. A quick wipe keeps the top looking great.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Mc

customer_reviews.title: Don't ever clean it. Waste of Money.
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of crap. Why ??? Don't ever, ever use the oven cleaning feature. The first time we did, it fried the controls and the oven door is locked in place. The controls are dead. Will have to see if anyone can repair this thing at a reasonable price. The range is 2.5 years old. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: clifton j

customer_reviews.title: useless..
customer_reviews.text: in 3 years Ive spent more on repairs that the unit cost. Samsung customer service? useless... Bart/VA
customer_reviews.author: Bart Simpson

customer_reviews.title: This model is EXTREMELY DANGEROUS. The forward position of ...
customer_reviews.text: This model is EXTREMELY DANGEROUS. The forward position of the cook top controls coupled with WEAK DETENTS creates a situation that is ESPECIALLY HAZARDOUS in that the cooktop burners can be unknowingly activated. This has happened several times among family and friends. The last incident caused extensive damage and breakage to the large front right burner of the cooktop. These controls would be readily accessible to YOUNG CHILDREN and TODDLERS causing immediate SAFETY TO LIFE ISSUES. I have rid myself of this range after less than a year and will not accept warranty repair or a new range of the same model.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Houck

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money Samsung never honored their warranty, even the warranty stand for 5 years. They never honored th😞
customer_reviews.author: Sameh henin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but bad news
customer_reviews.text: Off gassing for 2 weeks with 3x day use... something toxic is melting.
customer_reviews.author: Dromodor

customer_reviews.title: nice lookin but to many troubles not good
customer_reviews.text: self cleaning mode, locked your oven all the time, blow your thermal fuse and panel. -10 electric range
customer_reviews.author: wow maintenance, llc

customer_reviews.title: Range never worked. Samsung won't send anyone to fix it.
customer_reviews.text: The range never worked. Samsung won't send anyone to fix it and Amazon won't post my negative review because I need to: "focus on specific features of the product and your experience with it." The specific feature is that it doesn't work and my experience is that company won't repair it. Good to know that Amazon doesn't publish perfectly reasonable negative reviews. I'll be looking elsewhere for product information and purchases.
customer_reviews.author: M. Scanlon

customer_reviews.title: Range turns on VERY easily- FIRE HAZARD!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!!!! I am filing a formal complaint with Samsung. I just walked downstairs and my range was on again. It is so easy to bump into and turn on. I have 3 kids. I have even walked by it myself bumping it slightly and it turns on. I want it out of my house ASAP!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Acroficionado

customer_reviews.title: knob solution not best but works for now.
customer_reviews.text: I love this stove..super fast heat up. That is also the problem. As you can see from the photos way to easy to turn on by mistake. After lots if searching I had to child proof myself. I plan on just having pvc tube cut to replace this but works for right now.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Burners get too hot?
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this range, and absolutely love it! The ONLY problem I have noticed is that the stove top cooks very hot. If I have something on the lowest setting it still boils. Has anybody else had this problem?
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and cooks great
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Stylish, knobs feel solid, warming burner. Cons: Any dust, spillage, even the tiniest, will be highly noticeable on the black glass surface. (Delivery company from Home Depot did not install, "because glass tops - company policy does not allow").
customer_reviews.author: RunsWhileCan

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Am still getting the hang of all ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Am still getting the hang of all the bells and whistles but I am so proud of it.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE!  Residual Oven Heat---considered by buyer to be a safety hazard!
customer_reviews.text: After using oven (400 degs. for 20 mins) and turning off, oven fan continued to run as expected. After approx. 10 mins., fan stopped; temp. of exterior underside of the oven control panel then rose to a temp. in excess of 175 degs F(too hot to touch-will burn fingers, especially those of a child). When contacting mfgr., was advised this was by design and was to be expected!!!!
customer_reviews.author: dlm35

customer_reviews.title: liked this model very much
customer_reviews.text: Am still shopping, liked this model very much, but what bothers me when you get close to the stove your foot hits the bottom drawer. I wonder if that is how it was set up in the store, or if that is so. That would be a dealbreaker for me. Any comments for me?
customer_reviews.author: Helga Buehner

customer_reviews.title: Product on Back order... 3 months and counting
customer_reviews.text: Cannot deliver products to customers. I brought 4 major appliances all from Sasumg in Sept 2013. Three of the four appliances were delivered 2 weeks late due to Samsung on Nov 5. Then the microwave did not function as normal upon install and a technical had to come out 5 days later. I was told numerous ocassions these were coming only to have the date pushed back. The range was promised on multipe date: Oct 25th then Nov 5th then Nov 20th and now no one is saying anything about the range. Cannot cook anything for Thanksgiving. If you order this weekend Thanksgiving 2013 weekend beware you may not get your range for several months.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Steuer

product_meta.title: Samsung NE58F9500SS Slide-in Electric Range
product_meta.description: Sleek, slide-in design appears customizes with cabinetry Cooktop includes 5 elements: 6/9 in. and 9/12 in. dual elements, two 6 in. elements and warming element Dual Fast Boil element helps you boil water quickly and saves you time when cooking Smooth ceramic surface is super easy to clean Extra-large 5.8 cu. ft. oven easily accommodates a big roast, multiple casserole dishes or several racks of cookies Intuitive controls offer simple, step-by-step instructions for choosing cooking options Built-in probe allows you to monitor the temperature so you never have to guess whether your meats and poultry are cooked properly Stylish, wide-angle glass oven window complements other modern kitchen elements
feature_bullets: 5.8 Cu. Ft. Capacity Dual Convection Oven

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.6 out of 5 stars74 ratings2.6 out of 5 stars
